      • sum

        public static double sum​(double[] array)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Sums all elements of the array and returns the result
        Parameters:
        array - the array which we want to sum all of its elements
        Returns:
        the array accumulated sum
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the array is null

      • arrayIsGreater

        public static boolean arrayIsGreater​(double[] arrayA,
                                     double[] arrayB)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Determines whether the sum of the elements of the first array is greater than the sum of the elements of the second
        Parameters:
        arrayA - the first array
        arrayB - the second array
        Returns:
        true if the sum of the elements of the first array is greater, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any of the vectors is null

      • dominates

        public static boolean dominates​(double[] arrayA,
                                double[] arrayB)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Determines whether the first array dominates the second. This means that, for each dimension of the array, the value of array A is greater than or equal to the value of array B
        Parameters:
        arrayA - the first array
        arrayB - the second array
        Returns:
        true if array A dominates array B, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any of the arrays is null or if dimensions do not match

      • copyArray

        public static double[] copyArray​(double[] array)
        Creates a new array as a copy of the argument array
        Parameters:
        array - the array to copy
        Returns:
        the reference to then new object created or null if the input argument is null

      • sumArrays

        public static double[] sumArrays​(double[] arrayA,
                                 double[] arrayB)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a new array which is the sum of both argument vectors
        Parameters:
        arrayA - the first array
        arrayB - the second array
        Returns:
        a new array which is the sum of both arrays
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if sizes of both arrays do not match or if any of the input arguments is null
